revised_title: The Pulmonary Vessels' Vaso-Motor Fibers and the Independence of Pulmonary Circulation
tldr: The author investigates the pulmonary vessels' vaso-motor fibers and concludes that the pulmonary circulation is comparatively independent of the systemic circulation. The pulmonary blood-pressure is affected by systemic pressure causing venous distension and an increased supply to the right side of the heart. The vaso-motor mechanism in pulmonary vessels is likely less developed than in systemic arteries.
